questions.question: It was .............................. a frightening experience that I couldn’t even cry.
................................ being rich and famous, she is very humble.
questions.description: Use despite before a noun or ing form.

questions.question: We worked day and night .............................., we could not meet the deadline.
questions.description: However does not connect two sentences. Use it after a full stop or a semicolon.

questions.question: ................................. her illness, she is always cheerful.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: You must quit .................................. you have no other option.
questions.description: For can mean because in a very formal style.

questions.question: The doorbell rang ............................... I closed the door.
She is an upright officer ................................. her brother is corrupt.
I learned English ................................ I might get a better job.
The performance was ……………………… brilliant that the applause lasted several minutes.
I will buy the snacks ..................................... you buy the tickets.
................................... I was in a hurry to leave, I forgot to lock the door.
................................. he wins the scholarship, he cannot go to university.
